definition: to break off or break open sth with one's hands/(fig.) to break off (a relationship)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
(Tw) affected/pretentious/to put on a display of histrionics/(from Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [ké-pai])
to bend/(slang) to turn a straight person gay
to straighten/(slang) to turn a gay person straight
to pull apart/to pry open with the hands
lit. to pull apart and knead to a pulp/fig. to analyze minutely from every angle/to chew sth over
variant of 雞掰|鸡掰[ji1 bai1]
(Tw) (vulgar) cunt (from Taiwanese 膣屄, Tai-lo pr. [tsi-bai])/(slang) to fuck around with/(used as an intensifier) fucking/fucked up

sentences.english: I still tend to move my fingers, almost subconsciously, when doing arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 當做算術時，幾乎是下意識的，我還是會想去掰手指。

sentences.english: He clutches my wrists, trying to pry my hands away.
sentences.chinese: 他捉住我的手腕，想要把我的手掰走。

sentences.english: I haven't had this much fun with an open-world game in years.
sentences.chinese: 我好幾年沒有玩到這麼牛掰的開放世界遊戲了。

sentences.english: He cut a piece of the loaf and gave it to the fairy, who thanked him and began to eat.
sentences.chinese: 他掰下一塊麪包給了精靈，精靈謝過他後開始喫起來。

sentences.english: Peel the grapefruit, remove the film layer and only keep the inside flesh then tear into little pieces;
sentences.chinese: 大柚子去外皮後，再去掉瓣上的薄皮掰成小塊。

sentences.english: Li Tongzhong broke off a piece and savoured it carefully.
sentences.chinese: 李銅鐘掰下一塊，細細品嚐着。

sentences.english: I am not against lesbian at all. But you don't have to make her a lesbian.
sentences.chinese: 我一點也不反對女同，但你沒必要非把小萱掰彎吧？

definition: to pull apart/to pry open with the hands
to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to dig out/to pick out (with one's fingers)/to carve/to cut/to study meticulously/to lift one's clothes/stingy/miserly
to pull/to stretch/to draw sth out
erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
carpenter's plane/to plane (woodwork)/to shave off/to peel (with a potato peeler etc)
to dig/to excavate/(coll.) to exclude/not to count/to deduct/to subtract
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
